section.name: Executive Summary
section.snippet: QuizZum is an AI-powered learning tool designed to alleviate student overwhelm and cognitive overload when processing complex academic material. It achieves this by providing a frictionless platform to transform lecture notes (text or PDF) into structured, digestible multi-level summaries (easy, medium, hard) and adaptive quizzes that target weak spots. Its core differentiators include a radical focus on simplicity, an active and "playable" learning experience, and hierarchical, adaptive content. This tool aims to make learning more efficient, engaging, and less daunting for students.

section.name: Project Classification
section.snippet: This project is classified as a Web Application (web_app) due to its web-first approach and browser-based accessibility. It operates within the EdTech domain, aligning with educational content and student learning. The overall complexity is assessed as Medium, reflecting the AI integration and adaptive features.

section.name: Product Scope
section.snippet: MVP includes Text/Lecture Notes Input, PDF Upload for Notes, Multi-level Summaries, Quiz Module, Adaptive Follow-up Quizzes.

section.name: web_app Specific Requirements - Platform Support
section.snippet: Single Page Application (SPA); Browser Matrix: Latest stable versions of Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Brave, Opera on desktop; Fully responsive design.

section.name: Epic 1: Foundation & Core Content Input
section.snippet: Goal: Establish the basic application infrastructure and allow users to provide content for processing. Covers FRs: FR1, FR2, FR18, FR19, FR20.

section.name: Story 1.1: (MVP) Project Setup & Initial Web App Structure
section.snippet: User Story: As a developer, I want to set up the project repository and initial web application structure, so that I can begin implementing core features. Acceptance Criteria cover Git, SPA structure, and basic empty web page display.

section.name: Project Initialization
section.snippet: The project will be initialized using Next.js (JavaScript), Tailwind CSS, and Headless UI. Includes initial setup commands and architectural decisions provided by the starter.

section.name: Decision Summary
section.snippet: Lists critical and important architectural decisions including Data Persistence (PostgreSQL with Prisma), API Communication (RESTful Next.js ↔ FastAPI), AI Integration (Direct API Calls), Deployment Target (Local/Docker).

section.name: Project Structure
section.snippet: Details multi-repo structure: nextjs-frontend/, fastapi-backend/, docs/, docker-compose.yml.

section.name: Epic to Architecture Mapping
section.snippet: Epic 1: Foundation & Core Content Input maps to nextjs-frontend/src/app/(input) and fastapi-backend/app/api/(upload).

section.name: Technology Stack Details - Core Technologies
section.snippet: Frontend: Next.js (JavaScript), React, Tailwind CSS, Headless UI. Backend: FastAPI (Python), PostgreSQL, Prisma ORM.

section.name: Technology Stack Details - Integration Points
section.snippet: Next.js Frontend ↔ FastAPI Backend (HTTP/REST), FastAPI Backend ↔ PostgreSQL (Prisma), FastAPI Backend ↔ External LLM APIs (HTTP), FastAPI Backend ↔ Frontend (WebSockets).

section.name: Development Environment - Prerequisites
section.snippet: Node.js, Python, Docker, Git, pnpm/npm, pip/Poetry.

section.name: Development Environment - Setup Commands
section.snippet: Includes commands for Next.js, FastAPI, and Docker Compose for local setup.

section.name: Executive Summary
section.snippet: QuizZum aims to alleviate student overwhelm. Vision: AI-powered learning, radical simplicity, active/playable learning, adaptive content. Platform: Responsive web application. UX Complexity: Medium.

section.name: 1.1 Design System Choice
section.snippet: Chosen Chakra UI. (NOTE: This is outdated; Architecture document specifies Tailwind CSS + Headless UI).

section.name: 3. Visual Foundation
section.snippet: Color System: "Serene Learning" (pastels). Typography System: Modern, readable sans-serif fonts. Spacing and Layout: 8px grid system, responsive 12-column grid.

section.name: 4.1 Chosen Design Approach
section.snippet: Feature-forward (Guided) for input screen. Emphasizes clarity, support, proactive onboarding.

constraint.description: Frontend is Next.js (JavaScript) with Tailwind CSS and Headless UI.
Backend is FastAPI (Python) with PostgreSQL and Prisma ORM.
API communication is RESTful via HTTP between frontend and backend.
Local development uses Docker Compose for frontend, backend, and PostgreSQL.
Frontend React Components: PascalCase. JS Functions/Variables: camelCase.
Backend Python Modules/Files: snake_case. Functions/Methods: snake_case. Classes: PascalCase. API Endpoints: kebab-case.
P0 E2E test for basic page display required (Playwright or Cypress).
Frontend UI must remain responsive with loading indicators during backend processing (NFR1).
Backend endpoints must incorporate general security best practices (input sanitization) (NFR3).

interface.name: UploadTextAPI
interface.description: Accepts plain text content for processing.

interface.name: UploadPdfAPI
interface.description: Accepts PDF file for text extraction and processing.

standards.paragraph: Testing will follow a layered approach: Unit, Integration, and End-to-End (E2E).
Backend (FastAPI) tests will use `pytest` for Unit and Integration tests. Frontend (Next.js) tests will use `Jest` and `React Testing Library` for Unit/Component tests.
E2E tests will use `Playwright` or `Cypress` for critical user flows.
Quality gate criteria include 100% pass rate for P0 tests, and coverage targets for unit/integration tests.
